materials.raw_text: 7 g of Arsenic (As), 1 g of Cobalt (Co), 2 g of Sodium (Na), 3 g of Niobium (Nb), 8 g of Nickel (Ni)

sourcing.instructions: Arsenic can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online chemical retailers. Cobalt is available from metal suppliers or specialty stores. Sodium can be purchased from chemical suppliers. Niobium and Nickel can be found at metal suppliers or online marketplaces. Ensure all materials comply with safety regulations.
steps: Arsenic can be sourced from chemical supply companies or online chemical retailers. Cobalt is available from metal suppliers or specialty stores. Sodium can be purchased from chemical suppliers. Niobium and Nickel can be found at metal suppliers or online marketplaces. Ensure all materials comply with safety regulations.

1. In a fume hood or well-ventilated area, carefully weigh each component using a precise balance. 2. Place Arsenic, Cobalt, Sodium, Niobium, and Nickel in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Using a spatula, mix the dry powders thoroughly to achieve a uniform blend. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature resistant crucible.
preparation.raw_text: 1. In a fume hood or well-ventilated area, carefully weigh each component using a precise balance. 2. Place Arsenic, Cobalt, Sodium, Niobium, and Nickel in a clean, dry mixing container. 3. Using a spatula, mix the dry powders thoroughly to achieve a uniform blend. 4. Transfer the mixed powders into a high-temperature resistant crucible.

steps: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and allow it to heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the materials.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat the furnace to 1200°C. 2. Place the crucible in the furnace and allow it to heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the materials.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down gradually to room temperature. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 4-6 hours to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down gradually to room temperature. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 4-6 hours to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, use sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges or surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a protective coating to the surface to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. If necessary, use sandpaper to smooth out any rough edges or surfaces. 3. Optionally, apply a protective coating to the surface to enhance durability and prevent oxidation.
